profileAlternative.name: Anusha Ramachandra
profileAlternative.headline: Application Engineer at Google
profileAlternative.summary:
I'm an Application Engineer currently working at Google in the bay area. I have completed my Masters in Information Systems Management from Carnegie Mellon University. My interests include Software Development, Information Management and Product Management.

Earlier, I worked as Software Developer at PayPal. I developed services and user interfaces for Consumer Wallet Division on multiple platforms such as Java and NodeJS. I built front end-user interfaces right from UX mockups using ReactJS, for a new payments platform.

aboutAlternative.text:
I'm an Application Engineer currently working at Google in the bay area. I have completed my Masters in Information Systems Management from Carnegie Mellon University. My interests include Software Development, Information Management and Product Management.

positions.description:
• Developed a Java Rest based service that allowed users to save money in their PayPal wallet periodically by allowing to set up a schedule or threshold based arrangement from their accounts.
• Designed and developed a service based on a drools rule engine to decide eligibili...

positions.title: Software Intern
positions.description:
• Built a metric dashboard to monitor and report metrics of various backend services of PayPal.
• Developed User Interface to add dynamic widgets on the fly and select the services which need to be monitored along with appropriate metrics.
• Developed cron job using NodeJS to collect periodic data and dump into OpenTS...

educations.title: R. V. College of Engineering, Bangalore

given.text:
Anusha is hardworking, humble and easy to work with. Over the course of her summer internship she made significant improvements in her coding ability, particularly in style and testability. I was impressed with her ability to learn and tie together various large, proprietary platforms to create a working system within a short time frame. She managed to do this with very minimal guidance.

She demonstrated strength in topics that are typically lacking in new college graduates: appreciation for total cost of software ownership and operations, passion for quality software and sensitivity to business constraints.

I’m glad to have had the experience of working with her over the summer. Anusha would be valuable asset to any project. See less

Anusha is a very meticulous engineer and that reflects in everything she does - right from coding to design to documentation. Her work is of high quality and she ensures that she has thought through the bigger product landscape while implementing the solutions. I would particularly like to mention her efforts on going out of her way in building front end tech capabilities in the team and delivering a new product from scratch. Anusha is a talented person and shares a great rapport with her team. Wishing her all the very best! See less

items: Gracehopper Conference for Celebration of Women In Computing (Annual Attendee)
ImpressIT - Proof of Concept IT Solution
Comparison of Different Learning algorithms for Categorisation and Sentiment Analysis
